As at 31 December 2017, the Group‘s and the Company's current liabilities exceeded its current assets by US$1,15243 million and US$748.8 million respectively (2016: US$370,2 million and US$382.0 million respectively). The ﬁnancial statements have been prepared on a going concern basis as the management is reasonably confident thatthe Group will have sufficient resources including committed rental cash flows and unutilised committed banking facilities for it to pay its debts as and when they fall due.

The financial statements have been prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards (“IFRSs) as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board (“|ASB),

The ﬁnancial statements have been prepared on a historical cost convention. except as disclosed in the accounting policies and explanatory notes below. The financial statements are presented in the Group's functional currency, United States Dollar (US$), and all values are rounded to the nearest thousand (US$000), except when otherwise indicated.

The preparation of ﬁnancial statements in conformity with IFRSs requires management to exercise its judgment in the process of applying the Group’s accounting policies, It also requires the use of certain critical accounting estimates and assumptions.
